html_notes:
Rewrite the entire current CLI and bash scripts in bun and TypeScript. Ensure anytime a replacement is done it should be grep'd across the entire code base to ensure it's updated. Ensure that all child processes are killed when a user does a Ctrl + C as some of the binaries spawn other processes.
  1. Killing process families with node (might be relevant)
  2. Listen for CTRL+C with Bun
  3. Child processes
  4. https://discord.com/channels/876711213126520882/1346941110433480764
name: Environment Setup
notes:
Rewrite the entire current CLI and bash scripts in bun and TypeScript.

Ensure anytime a replacement is done it should be grep'd across the entire code base to ensure it's updated.

Ensure that all child processes are killed when a user does a Ctrl + C as some of the binaries spawn other processes.
    https://medium.com/@almenon214/killing-processes-with-node-772ffdd19aad (might be relevant)
    https://bun.sh/guides/process/ctrl-c
    https://bun.sh/docs/api/spawn
    https://discord.com/channels/876711213126520882/1346941110433480764

html_notes:
Problem The stack is too hard to stand up from scratch so very few people choose to stand it up even to test the OSS offering. Solution This project will create an automated installation tool. This tool will be CLI based. Goals
  1. Easy standing up of a Panfactum cluster by a user in a single environment.
    1. Every cluster needs to live in it's own region.
      1. Script available to do this.
  2. Encapsulate the cluster setup part of the bootstrapping guide as a CLI based tool.
    1. Start at "AWS Networking".
    2. End at "Databases".
  3. Take user input for any variables that need to be defined. The user should not need to create any files manually.
  4. Ask which SLA and warn it is not easily changed.
  5. Update all documentation and the website to point to this tool.
    1. Folder structure added in.
name: Automated cluster installation
notes:
Problem
The stack is too hard to stand up from scratch so very few people choose to stand it up even to test the OSS offering.

Solution
This project will create an automated installation tool. This tool will be CLI based.

Goals
    Easy standing up of a Panfactum cluster by a user in a single environment.
        Every cluster needs to live in it's own region.
            Script available to do this.
    Encapsulate the cluster setup part of the https://panfactum.com/docs/edge/guides/bootstrapping/overview as a CLI based tool.
        Start at "AWS Networking".
        End at "Databases".
    Take user input for any variables that need to be defined. The user should not need to create any files manually.
    Ask which SLA and warn it is not easily changed.
    Update all documentation and the website to point to this tool.
        Folder structure added in.

html_notes:
Problem: There isn't a way to quickly ask about our documentation Solution: Cursor will be used to ask questions panfactum's documentation, being non version specific. Goal:
  1. Local MCP Server connects to Cursor, sends API request to local agent/orchestrator server, then sends response back to Cursor
  2. Agent/orchestrator codebase in Typescript ElysiaJS
  3. Naive RAG + BM25
  4. We are not going to be setting up the automatic data ingestion from api's/web scraping into the database
  5. Deployment in a CI/CD pipeline
Needed Infrastructure:
    1. PostgreSQL
      1. Extensions:
        1. VectorChord-BM25
    2. Milvus (Vector DB)

html_notes: https://panfactum.slack.com/archives/C081ZFRU3ME/p1743028607835679 @Tommy Hi Tommy! I wanted to touch base about our upcoming project to optimize our Netlify costs by downgrading from the Enterprise plan. Here's what you need to know: *Timeline & Urgency:* - Our Netlify contract renewal date is May 15th - After reviewing the contract, I noticed Netlify requires a 60-day notice to prevent automatic renewal - We're already past the 60-day mark, so we should notify them ASAP to avoid pushback - A testable version of our replacement will be ready by April 16th, allowing us to run both solutions side-by-side without disruption - We'll cut over once testing confirms everything works properly Project Scope: 1. Continue using Netlify as our content host on their base team plan 2. Replace Netlify's automatic build process with our own build pipeline that will:    - Listen to the same webhooks    - Build assets and push them back to Netlify as deployments 3. Maintain rollback capabilities through Netlify's build history interface 4. Preserve deploy previews with links posted to PRs via Github's Status Check 5. Continue supporting branch-specific deployments and domains 6. Maintain AB testing functionality (with the caveat that environmental variables will need to move into the TOML file) Action Items: 1. Could you please confirm this scope looks correct and let me know if anything is missing? 2. Please reach out to Netlify immediately to notify them we won't be renewing and will be downgrading Let me know if you have any questions or need any clarification. Thanks! (edited
name: Bambee - Turning off Netllify Enhanced Build
notes:
https://panfactum.slack.com/archives/C081ZFRU3ME/p1743028607835679

https://panfactum.slack.com/team/U01Q8TUG319 Hi Tommy! I wanted to touch base about our upcoming project to optimize our Netlify costs by downgrading from the Enterprise plan. Here's what you need to know:
*Timeline & Urgency:*
- Our Netlify contract renewal date is May 15th
- After reviewing the contract, I noticed Netlify requires a 60-day notice to prevent automatic renewal
- We're already past the 60-day mark, so we should notify them ASAP to avoid pushback
- A testable version of our replacement will be ready by April 16th, allowing us to run both solutions side-by-side without disruption
- We'll cut over once testing confirms everything works properly
Project Scope:
1. Continue using Netlify as our content host on their base team plan
2. Replace Netlify's automatic build process with our own build pipeline that will:
   - Listen to the same webhooks
   - Build assets and push them back to Netlify as deployments
3. Maintain rollback capabilities through Netlify's build history interface
4. Preserve deploy previews with links posted to PRs via Github's Status Check
5. Continue supporting branch-specific deployments and domains
6. Maintain AB testing functionality (with the caveat that environmental variables will need to move into the TOML file)
Action Items:
1. Could you please confirm this scope looks correct and let me know if anything is missing?
2. Please reach out to Netlify immediately to notify them we won't be renewing and will be downgrading
Let me know if you have any questions or need any clarification. Thanks! (edited
